availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Rossamus S. Thomas (Hart County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Hart County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of H.W. Thomas and Grace Thomas. Married to Martha A. G. "Grace" Walters Thomas in Larue County, Kentucky on October 21, 1853. Father of Febe E. Thomas, Henry C. Thomas, James W. Thomas, and Mary M. Thomas. Farmer in Larue County, Kentucky in 1850. Farmer in Hart County, Kentucky in 1860. Employed John Ferry as a saddler in Hart County in 1860. Employed Julia Vass as a servant in Hart County in 1860. Employed James Lobb as a farmhand in Hart County in 1860. Owned two enslaved individuals in Hart County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Larue County, Hamiltons, p. 433B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hart County, Hammonsville, p. 861.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hart County, Division 2, p. 3.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Larue County Marriages, Film #000409559, p. 77 of microfilm.
Find A Grave, "Rossamus S. Thomas (Nov. 9, 1824-May 12, 1865)," Memorial # 14554157, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/14554157 (accessed May 22, 2020).
